item.title: Driving 16 LEDs using only three pins of an Arduino
item.description: It has been quite a while since I last played with the Arduino so I figured it was about time to do so. In this article I’ll show you how you can drive 16 LEDs with two 8-bit shift-registers using only three pins of the Arduino. So lets get started! Parts list For this build we’re using the following parts: Arduino UNO (any Arduino will do actually) Breadboard (with at least 32 rows to fit the components) 16 x LEDs 16 x resistors (220 Ohm) 2 x 74HC595 shift-registers Enough jumper wires to tie it all together Schematic The wiring for this build is actually pretty simple.
